subject: RE: [junit] junitx: access levels
msgSnippet: ... Yes, I understand the reasons for having private constructors. The question then is, why does the test need to call it? For both Singletons and Enums, I
messageBody:
junit@yahoogroups.com wrote:
> The constructor would be private if is a singleton class i.e only one
> instance is created and you use a static getInstance() method to get
> that instance.
>
> Also, you might want it so that only the class is allowed to create
> it's own instances for example if you wanted to create type safe
> enumerations:
>
> http://www.javacamp.org/designPattern/enum.html

Yes, I understand the reasons for having private constructors. The question
then is, why does the test need to call it? For both Singletons and Enums, I
don't see the need. So I'm interested in the reasons and needs in the
specific case of the original poster.

Cheers, Ilja
